Question: Removing specific items in Arraylist: :I am struggling with removing items from my arraylist. More specifically, I have two arraylists, being persons and vulcanos. Both are located in a grid. Each time step, people can move or not (this happens randomly, to the adjecant cells), while volcanos are static during the whole simulation. Volcanos can erupt or not. This is determined by a probability defined by the user. When at a certain timestep a person is located at the same cell as an erupting volcano, this person dies. But I don't know how I can remove that specific person from my array. So far I got the following (is repeated for each time step). for (int j = 0; j < persons.size(); j++) {    for (int k = 0; k < volcanos.size(); k++) {        if ((persons.get(j).getXCoordPerson()) == (volcanos.get(k).getXCoordVolcano())                && (persons.get(j).getYCoordPerson()) == (volcanos.get(k).getYCoordVolcano())                && (volcanos.get(k).getEruptionStatus() == true)) {            // all persons being on the same cell as an erupting volcano die        }    }}
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer: ASSISTANT:
response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: List<Person> persons = ...;
List<Volcano> volcanos = ...;
Iterator<Person> personIterator = persons.iterator();
while (personIterator.hasNext()) {
int j = personIterator.next().getXCoordPerson();
int k = volcanos.iterator().next().getXCoordVolcano();
if (j == k && volcanos.iterator().next().getEruptionStatus()) {
// all persons being on the same cell as an erupting volcano die
personIterator.remove();
}
}
<<<explanation>>>: The remove() method of the Iterator interface removes the current element from the underlying collection. This method is used to remove the current element from the iteration. The current element is the one pointed to by the iterator's next field. The iterator is then advanced to the next element in the iteration. This allows you to remove the specific person from the arraylist.
